page.title: 11HOUSING
page.content: Of the 100 or so households in Broadwell, half are owner-occupied, a third are rented from the Local Authority and the remainder are either rented privately or are Agricultural Service tenancies. The older houses are built of stone, most of the council houses are brick, while a few newer houses are made of artificial materials. The local planning Authority would require prominent or 'listed' houses to be built in natural Cotswold stone. About 6 cottages are used by week-enders. There are several cottages and houses owned by people who have come to retire.
